meanings.definition: Very small in size or scale, requiring a microscope to see.
meanings.sent1: The microscopical organism was invisible to the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the microscopical cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The microscopical dust particles danced in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was so microscopical, she noticed every tiny flaw.
meanings.sent5: The microscopical world revealed itself through the lens of the microscope.

meanings.sent2: The lab technician handled the microscopical slides with care.
